instructions.instruction: While presenting your research findings over Zoom, you realize your screen is sharing your desktop wallpaper — a silly meme you forgot was there. Colleagues start laughing. What do you do next?
During a workshop, you mispronounce a technical term repeatedly until someone gently corrects you. The room chuckles. How do you respond?
You’re facilitating a meeting when your phone starts playing an unexpected ringtone — a popular cartoon theme song. Everyone looks over. What do you do next?
While introducing a new colleague, you accidentally mix up their name with someone else’s in front of the group. The mistake is noticed. How do you handle the moment?
Giving a presentation, you reference a slide, but realize you’ve been talking about the wrong one for several minutes. People are a bit confused. What do you do next?
On your first day at a new job, you walk confidently into the wrong meeting room and interrupt a serious discussion. The attendees look surprised. How do you proceed?
You send a direct message meant for a friend — containing an inside joke — to your entire team’s group chat. Some team members react with emojis. What’s your next step?
During a group brainstorming session, you enthusiastically pitch an idea, only to realize you misunderstood the original prompt. Everyone pauses. How do you respond?
While sharing your screen in a training session, a notification pops up showing a reminder you set for yourself: 'Don’t forget snacks.' The group sees it. What do you do next?
At a formal event, you accidentally spill water on your own notes right before your speech. Others notice and wait for you to continue. How do you handle the situation?
You trip slightly while walking up to accept an award, catching yourself just in time. The audience lets out a collective gasp, then silence. What do you do next?
While leading an icebreaker game, you forget the rules halfway through and the group looks to you for direction. There’s a brief, awkward pause. How do you proceed?
During a video call, your pet walks across your keyboard, briefly turning off your camera and mic. When you return, everyone is smiling. What’s your response?
In the middle of a group project presentation, you realize you’ve mixed up your slides with someone else’s. Your teammates notice the error. How do you react?
You’re facilitating a Q&A session when you answer a question in detail, only for the questioner to clarify that wasn’t what they meant at all. The group looks on. What do you do next?
You accidentally start speaking while muted during a virtual meeting and go on for a while before noticing. Colleagues point it out in the chat. How do you respond?
During a classroom discussion, you confidently state a fact — only to have your teacher gently correct you. Some classmates quietly laugh. What’s your next move?
While writing on the whiteboard, you realize you’ve misspelled a simple word in front of everyone. Some participants notice and grin. How do you handle this?
At the start of a team call, you launch into your opening remarks, only to realize your microphone was off the whole time. Everyone is waiting. What do you do next?
You try to play a video clip during a seminar, but it fails to load and instead plays a funny commercial you’d watched earlier. The room reacts. How do you respond?
While networking at a conference, you address someone by the wrong company name. Others at the table catch your mistake. What’s your immediate reaction?
You arrive late to a group meeting, then accidentally sit in the team leader’s chair. People glance over and smile. What do you do next?
Giving a class presentation, your slideshow transitions include unexpected, over-the-top sound effects. The audience looks surprised and amused. How do you proceed?
During a lunch break, you enthusiastically join a conversation, only to realize too late they’re discussing a topic you know nothing about. Everyone turns to you. What do you do next?
You realize you’ve had spinach stuck in your teeth during an important interview, and your interviewer finally points it out. What’s your reaction?
